result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan Jw Leisten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Writings or Objects, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

cases #14CF183 and #14CF185 called at 1:08pm. [MK]
Defendant Jordan JW Leisten in court, in custody, with Attorney Yelena O. Zarwell.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #2 in Case #14CF183 and on Count #1 on Case #14CF185; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (the victim impact statements and restitution requests are submitted); the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Leisten guilty in both cases, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On agreement of the parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #1 and #3 of Case #14CF183, and Counts #2 of Case #14CF185.

In Case #14CF185 on Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Leisten to 6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentences in being.  
The Court finds that Mr. Leisten is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Leisten is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.
The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:  
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--to submit to random urinalyses as required by the Agent
--no possession or conumption of controlled substances without a valid precription
--no possession or consumption of alcohol unless approved by the Agent
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offenders except in a structured treatment or therapeutic setting, and except for incidental contact for employment and educational purposes as approved by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming as approved by the Agent
--to pay resitution of $1000 to Daniel J. Kueht
--to pay the 10% restitution processing fee 
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

In Case #14CF183 on Count #2, the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Leisten on Probation for three years, consecutive to Case #14CF185, with conditions:  
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--to submit to random urinalyses as required by the Agent 
--no possession or conumption of controlled substances without a valid precription
--no possession or consumption of alcohol unless approved by the Agent
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offenders except in a structured treatment or therapeutic setting, and except for incidental contact for employment and educational purposes as approved by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming as approved by the Agent
--to pay resitution of $500 to Catherine J. Kueht
--to pay restitution processing fee 
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
Days credit for time already served:  0 days.

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Statute 941.291 body armor prohibition imposed; penalties recited
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 1:46pm.

cases #14CF183 & #14CF185 called at 11:03am. 
Defendant Jordan JW Leisten in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (for Attorney Yelena O. Zarwell).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Leisten waives his right to Preliminary Hearing in both cases; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial in both cases.

Arraignment held in both cases:
--service of Informations admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
recess 11:08am. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/8/14 at 10:20am. (2) schedule both cases for Status Conference approximately three weeks after the Pretrial date (Mr. Leisten continues to serve a sentence in the Waukesha County Jail)

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF183, #14CF185 called at 8:30am. 
Defendant Jordan JW Leisten in court, in custody.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
These cases are scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  
Mr. Leisten indicates that he desires counsel, but he has not made any efforts to contact the Public Defender or seek counsel.
The Court reviews right to counsel, instructing Mr. Leisten to request to meet with the Waukesha PD at the Waukesha County Jail for them to make an eligibility determination, so that the Jefferson PD can appoint counsel.  
Mr. Leisten is provided with extra copies of the Criminal Complaints so that he has those for use in meeting with the PD.
The Court adjourns and will reschedule the Prelims.
recess 8:40am. 


NEXT:  (1) clerk to send a copy of these minutes to the Jefferson PD to alert them to Mr. Leistens forthcoming PD counsel request (2) reschedule Preliminary Hearings in each case

cases #14CF183 and #14CF185 called at 1:51pm. 
Defendant Jordan Jw Leisten in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of both Complaints admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Constitutional rights are given
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

During bond arguments, Lauren Kueht requests that the Court not prohibit contact by Mr. Leisten with her.

The Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond (applies to both cases), with conditions: 
--no direct or indirect contact with Catherine Kueht or Daniel Kueht
--no contact with Lauren Kueht except for purposes of arranging child placement or discussing child-related issues
---no possession of any financial documents, cards, or financial information that is not in his own name
--no presence at the Kueht residence: N5210 Golden Lake Park Road, Oconomowoc
--not to be present at any pawn stores
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 1:58pm. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/30/14 at 3:40pm.  (2) schedule both cases for Preliminary Hearing approximately 2-3 weeks after the Pretrial date
